entry.title: black-billed magpies (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that black-billed magpies are known to eat ticks off deer and other large mammals (example pictured)?

entry.title: nevoid melanoma (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that unlike most skin cancers, a nevoid melanoma may have an almost perfectly symmetrical shape?

entry.title: Storm Poly (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Storm Poly caused hundreds to be stranded at Amsterdam's central station as it passed the nation?

entry.title: Hackaball (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that children have programmed Hackaball as a Magic 8 Ball, a whoopee cushion, and an alarm clock?

entry.title: Cisco wine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Cisco wine was nicknamed "liquid crack"?

entry.title: American Anthropometric Society (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Walt Whitman's brain was donated to the American Anthropometric Society but was accidently destroyed?

entry.title: an empty room would look like (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Edward Hopper wondered what an empty room would look like with no one to see it?

entry.title: Let's All Go to the Lobby (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Let's All Go to the Lobby, a one-minute filmed advertisement, has been preserved by the US National Film Registry?
